thread.title: SAN BERNARDINO: Police chase ends with home invasion, arrest
thread.title_full: SAN BERNARDINO: Police chase ends with home invasion, arrest - Press Enterprise

author: PETER SUROWSKI
title: SAN BERNARDINO: Police chase ends with home invasion, arrest
text:
BY PETER SUROWSKI / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 10, 2015 Updated: 6:31 p.m. SAN BERNARDINO: Police chase ends with home invasion, arrest Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» A 13-year-old child who was scared out of a San Bernardino home by an intruder led police to a man they say took them on a chase through the city Saturday, Oct. 10, an official said.
The chase began at 4:23 p.m. when a caller reported a vehicle was stolen from the Twin Peaks area. The caller was following the thief at 40th Street and Waterman Avenue, and officers joined in at 30th Street and Waterman, San Bernardino police Lt. Rich Lawhead said.
The man was driving with a woman who wanted to exit the vehicle, but the driver refused to let her go. The officers tried to pull the man over, but he refused to stop, the lieutenant said.
The chase lasted six minutes and ended when the suspect stopped the vehicle near 24th Street and Carlton Street, jumped out and stormed into a nearby house. A 13-year-old child then ran out, quickly found officers and led them to the home, Lawhead said.
The officers entered and detained the suspect, who resisted arrest, he said.
The suspect's name was not available Saturday evening.
